Question: He had been tested by the famed scientist Pierre-Simon Laplace, whom this person later appointed to the Senate.
Hints: As **** I, he was Emperor of the French from 1804 to 1815.
This person's secretary, Bourrienne, disputed this allegation in his memoirs.
This person acknowledged one illegitimate son: Charles Léon (1806–1881) by Eléonore Denuelle de La Plaigne,.
